problem_text:
11.37. a) Can the free Burnside group B(m, n), for any m and n, be given by defining relations of the form vn = 1 such that for any natural divisor d of n distinct from n the element vd is not trivial in B(m, n)? This is true for odd n ⩾665, and for all n ⩾248 divisible by 29.
S. V. Ivanov
